intro: Enceliopsis tuta, commonly known as the desert tarplant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in sandy or gravelly soils. Enceliopsis tuta has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
